messages: 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:40): So it looks like one of the two bugs I filed in IE Connect was silently fixed at some point.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:40): Encouraging.  Maybe I'll file some more.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:41): was it reflexively WONTFIX'd anyway
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:42): god I wish Mozilla obsoleted Attr already
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:43): and other browsers too of course
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:43): but I mainly want to clean up the DOM spec :p
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:44): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6, no, both of my bugs got quick form responses saying: Thank you for your feedback.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:44): We were able to reproduce the issue and are investigating it.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:44): Best regards,
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:44): The Internet Explorer Team
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:44): Which is actually impressive by itself.
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (21:44): each time a Website is using it, make Firefox sends an email to the spec editor ;)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:45): i'd say "buy a lottery ticket" if randomness worked that way
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:45): Also, they kept them open after shipping IE9.  One is still open, the other is fixed, and I confirmed that the fixed one is actually fixed in 10PP2.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:45): D/DF/PI/DT/E/T/C is the new order
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:45): So actually my only complaint is that I don't seem to get e-mail for status updates, and there's no explanation of when the fixed one was fixed.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:46): Weird place for DF
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:46): I also abstracted out the adopting stuff 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:46): it's close to Document

1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (21:46): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, I really wish we had a simple way of having a feedback loop for people in charge of websites. It is hard to impossible to find the right persons, web agencies, departments.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:47): if only there was always actually someone in charge of websites :|
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:47): i think the new adopt stuff is quite good yes :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:48): now I just need to solve xxxhierarchy
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:48): and see how the mutating algorithms overlap
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:48): so there's only a few places to patch eventually for mutation events
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:50): almost midday
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (21:53): http://www.niso.org/topics/ccm/e-book_annotation/
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (21:53): Books in Browsers Meeting
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:54): How is the hit-testing going?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:54): f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 is finding out it is hard :)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:56): He's managing to make others write spec text, though
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:57): maybe he can make you do more than fix typos :p
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:59): f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905, btw, will you remove the pseudo-elements from CSS3 UI?
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:00): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: lol - what I was finding out is just how many *more* unprefixed CSS properties have been implemented.
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:00): (which may affect hit-testing yes)
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:01): regarding the pseudo-elements in CSS3-UI, I've already placed them all "at risk"
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:04): <ChrisL> can we please drop the 'levels' stuff
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:09): and will be keeping ::value and ::choices per implementer interest/intent (Mozilla) - but at this point looking at dropping the ::repeat-* pseudo-elements.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (22:10): next thing browsers need: modal save-as prompts
c805101c07cef966399ea737a8b204b7 (22:11): Maybe look at jquery to see how they did their modal stuff?
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (22:14): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 & c805101c07cef966399ea737a8b204b7: please contribute what you find to http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Dialogs
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:14): f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905, hmm, if they are going to be used for shadow DOM like stuff it might be better to wait for that

f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:16): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e - my understanding is that ::value and ::choices are simple enough that it will fairly easy to map them to shadow DOM like stuff when that is defined.
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:16): and if there is only one implementation of the pseudo-elements then they won't exit CR
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:16): so I'm ok with seeing if browser implement them or not and keeping/dropping accordingly.
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:16): *browserS
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:18): I think for shadow DOM though instead of having a bunch of pre-defined pseudo-elements we want something else
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:18): ::shadow(ident)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:18): and in your shadow tree you have <div pseudo=test> which can then be matched from the outside using ::shadow(test)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:19): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 might know more
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:19): because otherwise you need to keep updating the selectors grammar and in general it would not be very extensible
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:25): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I tried to convince dhyatt to do something like ::shadow(ident), but he insisted that we just use pseudo-elements.
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:25): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: and allow builders of shadow DOM to define them with "pseudo" attribute.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:26): but that does not work
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:26): ::foobar { } is dropped from a style sheet
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:27): unrecognized pseudo-elements do not make it past parsing
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:27): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: not in WebKit
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:27): that's a CSS compliance issue then
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:28): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: right http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2011Apr/0769.html
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:28): WebKit. we're awesome.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:29): well that extension makes sense
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:29): but that is not about not dropping unrecognized pseudo-elements on the floor
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:30): how would you know if a pseudo-element is unrecognized?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:30): http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3C!DOCTYPE%20html%3E%3Cstyle%3E%3A%3Atesttest%2Cbody{background%3Ared}%3C%2Fstyle%3E
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:31): only red in webkit
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:31): violating forwards compatible parsing rules

c805101c07cef966399ea737a8b204b7 (22:32): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98: I may have misunderstood your request. I'm looking at the slashdot example on the dialog wiki page, and that looks like jquery to me.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:32): WebKit. we've awesomely undocumented extensions and do not push for them in standards bodies
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:33): maybe TabAtkins should do it
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:33): he's smart

f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (22:37): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e - longer term it seems the ::shadow(ident) approach makes more sense. which is why I'm fairly conservative with adding new pseudo-elements. ::value and ::choices have specific uses / use-cases and implementer interest which is why I'm even considering them.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:45): B2G ‚Äî an entirely memory unsafe OS, on a limited memory platform?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:49): Limited memory and Gecko in one sentence?
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (22:51): "gecko causes me to have limited memory"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:53): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: Well, isn't that the implication of B2G? Or going down the Maemo/N900 route of needing swap space on microSD or the like?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:54): Dunno, I'm happy to have skipped that thread
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (22:55): swap on sd? sounds like a good way to have to replace an sdcard every couple months, heh
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:14): How do you get raw HTML hosted at github, like es5.github.com?  Does it require $$$?
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (23:29): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: http://pages.github.com/ if you like solutions which are not free, tied to a corporate for hosting ;)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:30): Yeah, so it's not free.  Figures.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:39): Do any modern browsers not have document.images?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:40): Gecko does, that much my source tells me
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:42): Hmm, looks like IE4+, NN3+, O3+
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:42): per http://blooberry.com/indexdot/html/topics/uastring-navobj.htm
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:47): Okay, I'd say my editing spec is ready for implementer review.
